Someone gave me a bag of chicken pars and it was a reminder that I needed to do certain things to keep myself safe. The chicken was frozen, but the bag was open, so I tied it before putting it into the refrigerator to thaw. I’m cooking it, now.

There are some general tips to keep in mind when safely handling meats that can help keep you and others from getting sick.

*    Refrigerate or or freeze meats as soon as possible. 
*    Place meats at the bottom of the refrigerator or freezer so that they don’t leak onto other food items, especially ready to eat items. 
*    When thawing frozen meats, it’s a good idea to place them on something, like a plate or tray, so that they don’t leak on other things.  
*    It’s a good idea to cook meats promptly.  Once cooked, meats can be eaten or portioned out and put back into the refrigerator or freezer.

My chicken is almost done. It’s quite a lot so I plan to portion it out and freeze most of it. I hope these reminders help you. For more information on food safety, visit https://www.foodsafety.gov/.
